alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 6:08PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern Santa Clara County, northern San Benito County and northeastern Monterey County, including the cities of Gilroy and Hollister. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Watsonville, Gilroy, Hollister, Prunedale, Ridgemark, Interlaken, San Juan Bautista, Aromas, San Martin, Las Lomas, Pajaro and Elkhorn. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
